member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.InLanguage(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ITwitterSearchQuery,System.String)
member.summary: Searches for tweets in a given language. Uses the two-letter ISO code, i.e. "EN" to represent the language.

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.InLanguage(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ITwitterSearchQuery,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Searches for tweets in a given language. Uses the given CultureInfo to locate a two-letter ISO code for the language.

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.Return(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ITwitterSearchQuery,System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies the number of tweets to return per page result.

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.Skip(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ITwitterSearchQuery,System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies the page of tweets to return. Omitting this expression is equivalent to requesting the first page. The number of tweets per page is either a Twitter default, or the value provided using .

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.Since(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ITwitterSearchQuery,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns only tweets since the last status ID.

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.Since(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ITwitterSearchQuery,System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns only tweets since the last status ID.

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.Within(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ITwitterSearchQuery,System.Double)
member.summary: Searches tweets within a given mile radius. This method must be used with the expression to provide a complete command. This will likely change with evolution of the Twitter API.

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.Since(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ITwitterSearchQuery,System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Returns only tweets that fall on or after the given date. Use the convenient extension methods provided for spanning time, i.e.
.Since(10.Days.Ago())

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.SinceUntil(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ITwitterSearchQuery,System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Returns only tweets that fall on or before a given date. Use the convenient extension methods provided for spanning time, i.e.
.SinceUntil(30.Minutes.Ago())

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.Of(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ITwitterSearchQuery,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Use this method combined with Within(double miles) to search areas around geo locations

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.Of(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ITwitterSearchQuery,Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Core.Geo.GeoLocation)
member.summary: Use this method combined with Within(double miles) to search areas around geo locations

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.WithUser(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ITwitterSearchQuery)
member.summary: Using this parameter will pre-pend the user's name before the status message in a search status result.

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.GetTrends(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ITwitterSearchTrends)
member.summary: Returns the current hashtag topics that are trending on Twitter right now.

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.PostPhoto(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ITwitterPhotos,System.String)
member.summary: Posts a photo inline to TwitPic during a request before making an API call to Twitter. This method should only be used with updating status, retweeting, or sending direct messages, as the new photo's URL is injected in the outgoing message; otherwise, the photo is posted but the URL is lost.
member.param: The current query expression
A path to the image
member.returns: The current query expression

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.PostPhoto(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ITwitterPhotos,System.String,Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Services.SendPhotoServiceProvider)
member.summary: Posts a photo inline during a request to a given provider, before making an API call to Twitter. This method should only be used with updating status, retweeting, or sending direct messages, as the new photo's URL is injected in the outgoing message; otherwise, the photo is posted but the URL is lost.
member.param: The current query expression
A path to the image
A photo posting service provider
member.returns: The current query expression

member.summary: Searches for tweets to the given user.

member.summary: Searches for tweets with negative wording.

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.UseUpdateTruncation(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.IFluentTwitterConfiguration)
member.summary: When this configuration option is called, any status updates that are longer than the 140 character option are truncated prior to sending. By default, updates longer than 140 characters will throw a
member.param: The current position in the fluent expression
member.returns: The current position in the fluent expression

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.UseUrlShortening(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.IFluentTwitterConfiguration)
member.summary: When this configuration option is called, any valid URLs found in user status text are sent out of band to the default URL shortening service provider, with the shortened URL replacing the longer one.
member.param: The current position in the fluent expression
member.returns: The current position in the fluent expression

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.UseUrlShortening(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.IFluentTwitterConfiguration,Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.ShortenUrlServiceProvider)
member.summary: When this configuration option is called, any valid URLs found in user status text are sent out of band to the specificed URL shortening service provider, with the shortened URL replacing the longer one.
member.param: The URL service provider to use
The current position in the fluent expression
member.returns: The current position in the fluent expression

members.member: When this configuration option is called, any valid URLs found in user status text are sent out of band to the specificed URL shortening service provider, with the shortened URL replacing the longer one. The URL service provider to use The API key to pass to the URL service provider The current position in the fluent expression The current position in the fluent expression

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.CacheWith(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.IFluentTwitterConfiguration,Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Core.Caching.IClientCache)
member.summary: When this configuration option is called, the specified cache provider is used for any subsequent caching on the request. The default caching strategy is this method is not used, is .
member.param: The caching strategy to use
The current position in the fluent expression
member.returns: The current position in the fluent expression

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.CacheUntil(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.IFluentTwitterConfiguration,System.DateTime)
member.summary: When this configuration option is called, any request made inside the specified absolute expiration date, is served from the client cache rather than from a request made to Twitter.
member.param: The specified local time that the cache for the request as defined will expire
The current position in the fluent expression
member.returns: The current position in the fluent expression

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.CacheForInactivityOf(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.IFluentTwitterConfiguration,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: When this configuration option is called, any request made inside the specified sliding expiratino date, is served from the client cache rather than from a request made to Twitter. Sliding expiration countdown begins from the last time a request for the same URL was executed.
member.param: The specified amount of inactivity that may elapse before expiring the cache
The current position in the fluent expression
member.returns: The current position in the fluent expression

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.UseRateLimiting(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.IFluentTwitterConfiguration)
member.summary:
When this configuration option is called, the request is checked against the current rate limit of the originating user or IP address, and is automatically delayed in reference to other queued calls by priority.
This feature will be available in version 1.0
member.param: The current position in the fluent expression
member.returns: The current position in the fluent expression

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.UseProxy(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.IFluentTwitterConfiguration,System.String)
member.summary:
When this configuration option is called, the query request is sent via the specified proxy URL, rather than directly to Twitter.
Currently, the .NET default of using the Internet Explorer defined proxy as a default for all outgoing requests is in place, but may change before the version 1.0 release.
member.param: The URL of a proxy to use
The current position in the fluent expression
member.returns: The current position in the fluent expression

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.Extensions.UseGzipCompression(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.IFluentTwitterConfiguration)
member.summary: When this configuration option is called, the query request is sent as GZIP encoded content, and automatically decompressed when received. This is useful for requests that retrieve a large number of results, but will increase bandwidth on smaller requests.
member.param: The current position in the fluent expression
member.returns: The current position in the fluent expression

member.name: P:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.TwitterClientInfo.ClientName
member.summary: This is the name of your client application. It is used to identify your client when a user updates their status, or when your application makes a Twitter Search API request.

member.summary: This is the version of your application. This is meta-data only, and not used by Twitter for client processing.

member.name: P:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.TwitterClientInfo.ClientUrl
member.summary: This is the URL of your application. This is meta-data only, and not used by Twitter for client processing. Your application's URL is stored by Twitter when you apply for a 'Source' attribute or register your application for OAuth.

member.name: P:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.TwitterClientInfo.ConsumerKey
member.summary: If your client is using OAuth authentication, this value should be set to the value of your consumer key. This avoids having to provide the key in every query.

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Core.OAuth.OAuthTools.UrlEncode(System.String)
member.summary: URL encodes a string based on section 5.1 of the OAuth spec. Namely, percent encoding with [RFC3986], avoiding unreserved characters, upper-casing hexadecimal characters, and UTF-8 encoding for text value pairs.

member.name: T:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Model.TwitterSearchStatus
member.summary: This data class represents a originating from a Search API class.

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Model.TwitterSearchStatus.op_Implicit(Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Model.TwitterSearchStatus)~Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Model.TwitterStatus
member.summary: This implicit conversion supports treating a search status as if it were a regular . This is useful if you need to combine search results and regular results in the same UI context.

member.name: P:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Model.TwitterSearchStatus.Id
member.summary: The unique identifier for this status.

member.name: P:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Model.TwitterSearchStatus.InReplyToUserId
member.summary: The user ID corresponding to the user who owns the status this status is in reply to.

member.name: P:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Model.TwitterSearchStatus.InReplyToStatusId
member.summary: The status ID for the status this status is in reply to.

member.name: P:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Model.TwitterSearchStatus.InReplyToScreenName
member.summary: The screen name for the user whose status this status is in reply to.

member.name: P:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Model.TwitterSearchStatus.IsTruncated
member.summary: If this status was sent to Twitter with more characters than allowed, it is truncated, and this property will return ; otherwise, it is .

member.name: P:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Model.TwitterSearchStatus.CreatedDate
member.summary: The date the status was created.

member.name: P:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Model.TwitterSearchStatus.ToUserId
member.summary: This represents the internal ID for the user who received a status in a search result. Keep in mind that this ID is currently meaningless to the Twitter API as it is not the same ID as the user's ID. It will eventually provide the correct ID for the target user.

member.name: P:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Model.TwitterSearchStatus.FromUserId
member.summary: This represents the internal ID for the user who wrote a status in a search result. Keep in mind that this ID is currently meaningless to the Twitter API as it is not the same ID as the user's ID. It will eventually provide the correct ID for the originating user.

member.name: M:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.FluentTwitter.ToString
member.summary: Returns the human-readable query to Twitter representing the current expression. If you are storing URLs for sending later, you can use AsUrl() to return a URL-encoded string instead.
member.returns: A URL-decoded string representing this expression's query to Twitter

member.name: P:Dimebrain.TweetSharp.Fluent.FluentTwitter.CacheKey
member.summary: Returns the key prepended to the URL when caching queries. If using basic authentication, this will be the authenticated user's username. If using OAuth, this will be the authenticated token.
